intro: Wisteria speciosa, commonly known as the Japanese wisteria, is a deciduous climbing vine native to East Asia. It is characterized by its long, cascading clusters of fragrant, violet-blue flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant has compound leaves composed of 12–20 oval-shaped leaflets. Its sturdy stems can reach lengths of up to 30 meters, making it a striking addition to gardens and arbors. Wisteria speciosa thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, requiring regular pruning to maintain its shape and encourage flowering.
